item.title: Application of Game Theory and Network Science in Climate Change Analysis.
item.description:
Conducted a comprehensive review of over 20 scholarly papers focused on the application of evolutionary and behavioral game-theoretic models in developing strategies for low-carbon energy trading and enhancing global climate action.

Employed network science techniques to analyze the strategic interactions and commitment levels among countries in international climate change mitigation efforts, mapping complex networks to illustrate these relationships.

Developed data-driven frameworks to summarize how climate-related risks (both physical and transitional) propagate through financial markets, impacting credit, market, liquidity, and operational risks across different geographic regions.

Utilized system dynamics modeling to investigate the cascading effects of extreme climate events on economic growth within interconnected climate-social systems, highlighting the role of network analysis in understanding systemic vulnerabilities and response mechanisms.

item.title: Management of Energy Systems for Sustainable Development.
item.description:
Conducted in-depth review of 20+ papers & reports (e.g., WB, IPCC, IMF) on circular economy, energy transition, international energy policy, net zero strategy, and sustainable development.

Analyzed green finance's role in driving renewable energy investment & authored insightful essay on energy transition opportunities & threats, providing recommendations for stakeholders.
